etymology.description: Phonetic rendering: Méng + tè + lì + ěr ≈ “Montreal.”
etymology.interpretation: Chinese transliteration of the Canadian city name “Montreal,” chosen to approximate its pronunciation. Characters are selected for sound; their individual meanings are incidental.
etymology.simplification: Only 爾 → 尔 was simplified to reduce strokes and standardize form; 蒙、特、利 remain the same.

parts.english: to cover; ignorant; to receive (favor); Mongolia (abbr.)

examples.chinese: 蒙特利尔位于加拿大魁北克省的西南部(蒙特利爾位於加拿大魁北克省的西南部)。
examples.pinyin: Méngtèlì'ěr wèiyú Jiānádà Kuíběikè shěng de xīnánbù.
examples.english: Montreal is located in the southwestern part of Quebec, Canada.

examples.chinese: 冬天的蒙特利尔常常下大雪(冬天的蒙特利爾常常下大雪)。
examples.pinyin: Dōngtiān de Méngtèlì'ěr chángcháng xià dàxuě.
examples.english: Montreal often gets heavy snow in winter.

examples.chinese: 我们计划明年去蒙特利尔旅游(我們計劃明年去蒙特利爾旅遊)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen jìhuà míngnián qù Méngtèlì'ěr lǚyóu.
examples.english: We plan to travel to Montreal next year.
